question: mango problem
answer:
Potash 30 kg per acre is needed 30 kg per acre in the form of nitrogen 27 kg, single super phosphate in the form of urea for mango cultivation. 1-3 year plants or trees of rudi fertilizer 5-20 kg, urea 100-200 grams, Single Super Fasfate 250-500 grams and Murate of Potash 175-350 grams per tree. Rudy manure 25 kg, urea 200-400 grams for 4-6 year plants or trees, Single Super Fasfate 500-700 grams and Murate of Potash 350-700 grams per tree.
 
Use for 7-9 year old plants or tree fertilizer 60-90 kg, Urea 400-500 grams, Single Super Fasfate 750-1000 grams and Murate of Potash 700-1000 grams per tree. Plants or trees of more than 10 years, 100 kg, urea 400-500 grams, Single Super Fasfate 1000 grams, Murate of Potash 1000 grams per tree. Put the nitrogen and potash in the month of February, while putting the compost and single superfault in December month only.
 
Many times due to the change of the weather, the fruit starts flowering, if the fruit appears, spray 10 grams per liter of 13:00:45.
